intro: Boechera divaricarpa, commonly known as the rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or arid regions. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. The plant has a compact growth form with hairy leaves and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
